cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 190 (Wednesday, November 15, 2023)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. PFLUGER:H.R. 6434.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1 Section 8The single subject of this legislation is:To require the publishing of an annual analysis describingillicit financial schemes and methods related to thetrafficking of fentanyl and other synthetic opioids.[Page H5894]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

bill.title: Combating Fentanyl and Financial Crimes Act of 2023

item.title: Combating Fentanyl and Financial Crimes Act of 2023
Combating Fentanyl and Financial Crimes Act of 2023

To require the Director of the Financial Crimes Enforcement Network to publish an annual Financial Trend Analysis describing illicit financial schemes and methods related to the trafficking of fentanyl and other synthetic opioids, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
